title: Task 80

question.text: What does actually imply in a sentence like I actually prefer working remotely?

answers.answer: The truth is contrary to what might have been assumed or stated before

answers.feedback: Actually in this context is used to express a real preference.

answers.answer: I always work in an office setting
answers.feedback: Using actually here is meant to reveal a preference for remote work, not office work.
Actually suggests a specific preference, contradicting the idea of having none.

description: The word actually is used when you want to tell the real fact about something, especially if it's different from what someone thought or said. It's like saying, No, this is how it really is. You use actually to make your point stronger or to correct what someone else said.
